block.p: Rabbi Yael Batya Ridberg, the associate rabbi of the West End Synagogue in Manhattan, is to be married today to Dr. Mark Steven Laska, a founder of Blink.com, an Internet search site. Rabbi Seth Frisch is to officiate at the Glenn Island Harbour Club in New Rochelle, N.Y.

Rabbi Ridberg, 31, is keeping her name. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison. She received a master's degree in Hebrew letters from the Reconstructionist Rabbinical College in Philadelphia and was ordained there. Her parents, Barbara Ridberg and Dr. Eugene Ridberg, live in Rockville, Md. The bride's father is a clinical psychologist, and her mother teaches the second grade at the Charles E. Smith Jewish Day School there.

Rabbi Yael Batya Ridberg, the associate rabbi of the West End Synagogue in Manhattan, is to be married today to Dr. Mark Steven Laska, a founder of Blink.com, an Internet search site. Rabbi Seth Frisch is to officiate at the Glenn Island Harbour Club in New Rochelle, N.Y.

Rabbi Ridberg, 31, is keeping her name. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison. She received a master's degree in Hebrew letters from the Reconstructionist Rabbinical College in Philadelphia and was ordained there. Her parents, Barbara Ridberg and Dr. Eugene Ridberg, live in Rockville, Md. The bride's father is a clinical psychologist, and her mother teaches the second grade at the Charles E. Smith Jewish Day School there.

Dr. Laska, 38, is also the vice president for community development of the Web site, which is based in Manhattan. He graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder and received a master's degree in ecology from Fordham University. He also holds a doctorate in ecology and evolution from Rutgers. He is a son of Estelle Laska and Dr. Eugene Laska of Larchmont, N.Y. His mother teaches in the nursery school of Riverdale Temple in Riverdale, the Bronx. His father is a research professor of psychiatry at the New York University School of Medicine and the director of the statistical sciences and epidemiology division of the Nathan Kline Institute for Psychiatric Research in Orangeburg, N.Y.
